description: Management of cybersecurity risks in the supply chain including hardware software and services used in BES Cyber Systems. Addresses vendor security assessment and supply chain visibility.
key_controls: Vendor assessment; Vendor agreements; Supply chain monitoring; Change notifications; SCRM program; Subcontractor management; Third-party access controls
applicable_entities: All Responsible Entities procuring for BES systems
risk_focus: Vendor compromise; Malicious code insertion; Hardware tampering; Software vulnerabilities; Supply chain attacks; Subcontractor risks
example_systems: Hardware suppliers; Software vendors; Service providers; Cloud services; Professional services; OEM support; Spare parts suppliers
compliance_scope: Addresses all organizations obtaining BES components

description: Protection of BES Cyber Systems through physical security measures including perimeter security access control surveillance and monitoring of facilities containing BES Cyber Systems.
key_controls: Physical Security Perimeter; Access control (badges biometrics); Surveillance; Intrusion detection; Visitor management; Emergency access; Perimeter testing; Physical monitoring
applicable_entities: Entities with High/Medium Impact BCS; CIP-014 critical facilities
risk_focus: Physical intrusion; Theft of equipment; Tampering; Sabotage; Unauthorized access; Natural disasters; Environmental hazards; Insider threats
example_systems: Control centers; Substations; Generation facilities; Critical infrastructure facilities
compliance_scope: High/Medium Impact and Critical Facility scope

description: Protection through electronic/cyber controls including network segmentation firewalls access controls and monitoring of electronic connections to BES Cyber Systems.
key_controls: Electronic Security Perimeter; Firewalls; Access control lists; MFA; Encryption; Network monitoring; IDS/IPS; SIEM; Application whitelisting; Port control
risk_focus: Unauthorized network access; Malware; Denial of service; Data exfiltration; Unauthorized modifications; Lateral movement; Protocol exploitation; Reconnaissance
example_systems: BES Cyber Assets; Protected Cyber Assets; EACMS; Network infrastructure

description: Management of personnel risk including background screening training and awareness programs to ensure only authorized and trained personnel have access to BES Cyber Systems.
key_controls: Personnel risk assessment; Background checks; Training programs; Awareness initiatives; Access authorization; Periodic access reviews; Termination procedures; Role-based training
applicable_entities: All Responsible Entities with BES Cyber Systems
risk_focus: Insider threats; Unauthorized access; Social engineering; Lack of security awareness; Credential compromise; Malicious insiders; Negligent access grants; Untrained personnel
example_systems: All personnel with BES access; Contractors; Vendors; Partners

description: Development and maintenance of documented cyber security policies and plans that establish the organization's security posture and compliance framework.
key_controls: Security policies; Security plans; Senior manager designation; Policy approval; Plan implementation; Governance structure; Roles and responsibilities; Policy reviews
risk_focus: Lack of security direction; Inconsistent controls; Compliance gaps; Inadequate governance; Accountability issues; Uncoordinated security; Policy misalignment; Leadership gaps
example_systems: Organizational policies; Operational procedures; Control specifications; Security governance

description: Management of changes to BES Cyber Systems and their configurations including documentation authorization testing and baseline maintenance to prevent unauthorized modifications.
key_controls: Change request process; Change authorization; Configuration baselines; Change testing; Configuration monitoring (35 days); Baseline reviews; Deviation investigation; Change logging
risk_focus: Unauthorized modifications; Configuration drift; Unplanned outages; Introduction of vulnerabilities; Loss of system integrity; Lack of change visibility; Unauthorized testing; Production impact
example_systems: BES Cyber Systems; Network infrastructure; SCADA systems; Control systems
compliance_scope: Applied to all systems within scope

description: Management of security vulnerabilities and patches including vulnerability assessments scanning penetration testing and timely application of security patches to maintain system security posture.
key_controls: Vulnerability assessment (15 months); Security patch management; Patch testing; Patch deployment; Patch exceptions; Compensating controls; Vulnerability tracking; Risk prioritization
risk_focus: Exploitation of known vulnerabilities; Unpatched systems; Security gaps; Delayed patch application; Patch failures; Compensating control inadequacy; Vulnerability accumulation; Technical debt
example_systems: All BES Cyber Assets; PCAs; EACMS; System components

description: Management of cyber security incidents and recovery including incident detection investigation response recovery plans and testing to minimize impact and restore operations.
key_controls: Incident response plan; Incident detection; Incident reporting (24 hours); Investigation & root cause; Containment procedures; Recovery plans; RTO/RPO definition; Backup procedures; Restore testing
risk_focus: Delayed incident response; Loss of critical data; Extended outages; Ineffective recovery; Forensic evidence loss; Compliance violations; Operational impact; Cascade failures
example_systems: All BES Cyber Systems; Critical infrastructure; Data protection

description: Protection of sensitive BES Cyber System information including encryption key management secure disposal and access controls to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of critical system data.
key_controls: BCSI identification; BCSI classification; Encryption (AES-128 at rest; TLS 1.2 in transit); Key management; Access controls; Secure disposal; BCSI inventory; Data loss prevention
risk_focus: Data breach; Unauthorized disclosure; Cryptanalysis; Key compromise; Encryption failure; Information loss; Regulatory violation; Competitive harm
example_systems: BES Cyber System Information; Credentials; Design data; Vulnerability info

description: Secure communication between control centers and between control centers and field devices including encryption and authentication to protect operational data and commands.
key_controls: Encrypted communications; ICCP security; Real-time data protection; Protocol security; Authentication; Integrity verification; Key exchange; Secure protocols
risk_focus: Eavesdropping; Man-in-the-middle attacks; Command injection; Data manipulation; Protocol exploitation; Session hijacking; Unauthorized access; Signal spoofing
example_systems: ICCP connections; Real-time coordination; Field communications; Market systems

description: Protection of physical equipment and systems including protective relays generators and transmission equipment from physical damage tampering or sabotage.
key_controls: Perimeter fencing; Surveillance; Access control; Tamper detection; Environmental controls; Equipment hardening; Cable protection; Equipment redundancy
risk_focus: Physical tampering; Equipment destruction; Cable cutting; Component theft; Environmental damage; Unauthorized equipment modifications; Cascading failures; Loss of protection
example_systems: Substations; Generation facilities; Protective relay systems; SCADA equipment

description: Implementation of security baselines and system hardening to reduce attack surface and vulnerability exposure on BES Cyber Assets and supporting systems.
key_controls: Security baselines; Operating system hardening; Application hardening; Configuration standards; Baseline documentation; Baseline comparison monitoring; Deviation investigation; Annual updates
risk_focus: Unnecessary services/ports; Weak configurations; Missing patches; Uncontrolled options; Default credentials; Unnecessary protocols; Attack surface expansion; Lateral movement ease
example_systems: BES Cyber Assets; PCAs; System components; Network devices

description: Management of logical access to BES Cyber Systems including user identification authentication authorization and remote access controls using multi-factor authentication.
key_controls: User identification; User authentication; MFA (remote access); Authorization; Role-based access control; Remote access protocols; Credential management; Privileged access management
risk_focus: Unauthorized access; Credential compromise; Privilege escalation; Lateral movement; Insider threats; Shared accounts; Weak authentication; Brute force attacks
example_systems: BES Cyber Systems; Control centers; Administrative access; Remote connections

description: Continuous monitoring and detection of unauthorized access and suspicious activities through SIEM IDS/IPS and logging to enable rapid incident response.
key_controls: 24/7 monitoring; SIEM implementation; IDS/IPS deployment; Log aggregation; Security alerting; Anomaly detection; Real-time response; Log retention (90 days)
applicable_entities: Entities with High/Medium Impact BCS; some CIP-015 requirements
risk_focus: Delayed threat detection; Missed incidents; Log data loss; Alert fatigue; False negatives; Detection gaps; Slow response; Forensic evidence loss
example_systems: All security systems; Network devices; BES Cyber Assets; Infrastructure

description: Periodic assessment of cybersecurity risks and threats to BES Cyber Systems and implementation of risk mitigation strategies to maintain acceptable risk posture.
key_controls: Annual risk assessment; BCS categorization; Impact analysis; Threat evaluation; Control assessment; Risk prioritization; Mitigation planning; Risk acceptance documentation
risk_focus: Risk blindness; Unmanaged threats; Inadequate controls; Compliance gaps; Resource mismatch; Unaddressed vulnerabilities; Strategic misalignment; Audit findings
example_systems: All BES systems; Critical infrastructure; Emerging threats; New technologies

description: Participation in NERC standards development and adaptation to emerging threats and technologies to keep compliance requirements current and aligned with threat landscape.
key_controls: Standards review; Comment submissions; Industry participation; Technology evaluation; Threat tracking; Standards proposals; Compliance interpretation; Industry coordination
risk_focus: Outdated standards; Non-aligned controls; Emerging threat gaps; Technology mismatches; Industry coordination gaps; Standards interpretation variance; Regulatory uncertainty; Innovation barriers
example_systems: Industry working groups; Standards bodies; Peer organizations
